marketNews.title: 2025 Economic Policy Package
marketNews.content:
The Government on Monday (16/12) announced a series of economic policy packages and a selective 12% VAT for 2025. Here are some of our important notes:
- Selective 12% VAT: The Government stated that the VAT increase to 12% will only be imposed on goods and services classified as luxury or premium. Based on the presentation at the press conference, here are some items that will be subject to 12% VAT:
- - Premium rice, premium fruits, and premium meat (such as wagyu)
- - Expensive fish, shrimp, and premium crustaceans (such as king crab)
- - Premium education services
- - Premium health services
- - Electricity tariffs for customers in the 3,500-6,600 VA category
The Government has not yet announced the detailed complete list of luxury goods and services subject to 12% VAT. Meanwhile, the government will bear a 1 percentage point VAT increase (DTP VAT) for wheat flour, industrial sugar, and Minyakita cooking oil, so the VAT will remain at 11%. Basic necessities such as rice, meat, fish, eggs, vegetables, and milk will remain exempt from VAT.
- Food and Electricity Assistance: The Government will provide food assistance in the form of 10 kg of rice per month for 2 months (January and February 2025) for 16 million recipients. Additionally, the government will provide an electricity tariff discount of 50% for 2 months (January and February 2025) for customers in the 2,200 VA category and below, covering ~80 million customers or equivalent to ~97% of PLN customers.
- Support for Labor-Intensive Sectors: The Government will absorb Income Tax (PPh 21) for workers in labor-intensive sectors with salaries up to 10 million rupiah per month. Furthermore, labor-intensive industries wishing to revitalize machinery will be given an incentive in the form of a special interest rate of 5%.
- Extension of Property Sector Incentives: The Government is extending the 100% DTP VAT incentive for landed houses and apartments until June 2025. For the July-December 2025 period, this incentive will be reduced to 50% DTP VAT. This incentive applies to residences with a maximum selling price of 5 billion rupiah on the first 2 billion rupiah. 
- Hybrid Car Incentives: The Government will absorb 3% Luxury Goods Sales Tax (PPnBM) for hybrid cars. Consequently, the PPnBM for hybrid cars will decrease from the current 7-8% to 4-5%. Nevertheless, there is still uncertainty regarding the plan to increase the PPnBM for hybrid cars. Previously, Kompas reported in July 2024 on the potential increase in hybrid car PPnBM by +2-4 percentage points to 10-12%, following the nullification of Government Regulation No. 74/2021 concerning Motor Vehicle PPnBM post realization of minimum investment of 5 trillion rupiah in the battery electric vehicle (BEV) industry.
- Extension of MSME Incentives: The Government will extend the imposition of a 0.5% tax for MSMEs with turnover up to 4.8 billion rupiah per year for 1 year specifically for MSME actors who have fully utilized this incentive (7 years). With this extension, MSMEs that have received incentives for 7 years will receive an additional duration of 1 year. For MSME actors who have only enjoyed this incentive for less than 7 years, the tax incentive they receive will remain valid for a maximum of 7 years.

marketNews.title: Tobacco Excise Duty Policy and HJE Adjustment for 2025
marketNews.content: The Government confirms it will not increase the Tobacco Excise Duty (CHT) rate in 2025, as previously conveyed. The Government also confirms it will increase the retail selling price (HJE) for cigarettes and electronic cigarettes in 2025. On average, the HJE for cigarettes will increase by +4% in 2025 (excluding electronic cigarettes and other processed tobacco products). The type of cigarette experiencing the highest percentage HJE growth is hand-rolled kretek cigarettes (SKT), especially in group II and III. Meanwhile, the HJE for electronic cigarettes will, on average, increase by +11% in 2025. This provision will take effect starting January 1, 2025.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Rate Expectation and Rupiah Weakness
marketNews.content: Economists surveyed by Reuters expect Bank Indonesia to maintain the BI Rate benchmark at 6% in the Board of Governors Meeting on December 18, 2024. This expectation has changed compared to 1 month ago, when economists still projected Bank Indonesia would cut the rate by 25 bps in December 2024. This change in expectation is driven by the continued weakening of the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar. Economists have also lowered their expectations for BI Rate cuts during 2025 from 100 bps to 75 bps due to the potential for a longer-term strengthening of the US dollar stemming from the protectionist policies of the US President-elect, Donald Trump.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Trade Balance Surplus in November 2024
marketNews.content: The national statistics agency (BPS) recorded that Indonesiaâ€™s trade balance surplus surged to 4.42 billion US dollars in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: surplus of 2.48 billion US dollars, November 2023: surplus of 2.41 billion US dollars), exceeding consensus expectations which predicted a surplus of 2.21 billion US dollars and marking the largest trade surplus since July 2024. This result was supported by a +9.14% YoY increase in exports (vs. expectations: +4.92% YoY), while imports only rose by +0.01% YoY (vs. expectations: +6.15% YoY). This result led to Indonesia's trade balance for 11M24 recording a surplus of 28.89 billion US dollars, with exports rising +2.06% YoY and imports growing +4.74% YoY.

marketNews.title: China's Retail Sales Growth Slowdown in November 2024
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that retail sales growth in China slowed to +3% YoY in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: +4.8% YoY), below consensus expectations which projected +4.6% YoY. This result marks the weakest retail sales growth since August 2024. On a monthly basis, retail sales decreased by -0.16% MoM in November 2024. For 11M24, retail sales in China grew by +3.5% YoY.

tickerNews.title: BBRI to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 135/Share, Indicating 3.2% Yield
tickerNews.content: BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia will distribute interim dividends for the 2024 fiscal year of up to ~20.5 trillion rupiah or 135 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is December 24, 2024, with payment on January 15, 2025. Referring to the BBRI share price at the close of Monday's trading (16/12) at 4,250 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 3.2%.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Records IDR 4.2 Trillion Net Profit (Bank Only) in November 2024
tickerNews.content: BBCA: Bank Central Asia recorded a net profit (bank only) of 4.2 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY, -28% MoM) in November 2024. This result brings the net profit (bank only) for 11M24 to 50.5 trillion rupiah (+14% YoY), surpassing the consolidated FY24 growth estimate from the consensus at +13% YoY. Credit growth reached +15.5% YoY in 11M24 (vs. 10M24: +14.2% YoY), exceeding management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of +10-12%, with the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio rising to 79% (vs. 10M24: 78%). Net Interest Margin reached 5.73% in 11M24 (+22 bps YoY), in line with management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 5.7-5.8%. The credit cost (CoC) for 11M24 was maintained at 0.23% (-8 bps YoY), better than management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 0.3-0.4%.

tickerNews.title: RATU to launch IPO by offering up to 20% of shares, with RAJA divesting 13%
tickerNews.content: RATU: Rukun Raharja ($RAJA)'s subsidiary, Raharja Energi Cepu ($RATU), plans to conduct an IPO by offering up to 543.01 million (20%) shares at a price of about 900-1,150 rupiah per share, so that the total funds raised amount to around 488.7-624.5 billion rupiah. Of this amount, approximately 353 million (13%) shares are divestment of RAJA's ownership, while the rest are new shares. Consequently, the potential funds obtained by RATU from this corporate action range from 171-218.6 billion rupiah, with the use of funds for loans to 2 subsidiaries for cash call payments related to the management of the Jabung Block and Cepu Block. Meanwhile, the funds obtained by RAJA from the divestment range from 317.7-405.9 billion rupiah. RAJA will remain the controller of RATU post-IPO with an ownership stake of ~80%. The public offering is scheduled to take place on January 2-6, 2025, with an estimated listing date on January 8, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SRTG increases stake in MDKA to 19.18%
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Merdeka Copper Gold shareholder, Saratoga Investama Sedaya ($SRTG), purchased 53.4 million MDKA shares at a price of 2,273 rupiah per share on December 13, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~121 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, SRTG's ownership in MDKA increased from 18.96% to 19.18%.

tickerNews.title: PSAB targets 2024 revenue of USD 230-240 million and maintains 100,000 oz gold production target for 2025
tickerNews.content: PSAB: The Director of J Resources Asia Pasifik, Sanjaya J., stated that the company targets revenue of around 230-240 million US dollars throughout 2024, growing +35-41% YoY, although he did not elaborate further on the net profit projection. Sanjaya also mentioned that PSAB is optimistic about recording gold production according to the 2024 target of 100,000 ounces, growing +6% YoY. During 11M24, PSAB had already produced 93,027 ounces of gold, equivalent to 93% of the 2024 target, with an average selling price of 2,300 US dollars per ounce. Going forward, PSAB targets to maintain a production level of around 100,000 ounces throughout 2025.

tickerNews.title: NCKL increases ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt to 20% by acquiring an additional 10%
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada announced it has purchased 10% of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt shares from an affiliate party, Li Yuen Pte. Ltd., amounting to ~2.1 trillion rupiah. After this transaction, NCKL's ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt becomes 20%. NCKL stated that this transaction was carried out considering the promising business development potential of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt.

tickerNews.title: BSDE to conduct mandatory tender offer for remaining SMDM shares
tickerNews.content: BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai announced it will conduct a mandatory tender offer for the remaining shares of Suryamas Dutamakmur ($SMDM) from December 17, 2024, to January 15, 2025, at a price of 531 rupiah per share. This price is +2.12% higher than the SMDM share price at the close of Monday's trading (16/12) at 520 rupiah per share. This corporate action is part of BSDE's acquisition of 91.99% of SMDM shares worth 2.3 trillion rupiah in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: KARW controlling shareholder sells 5.4 million shares to expand retail base ownership
tickerNews.content: KARW: The controller of Meratus Jasa Prima, PT Saranakelola Investa, sold ~5.4 million KARW shares at an average price of 6,376 rupiah per share on December 6-11, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~34.4 billion rupiah and was aimed at expanding the retail investor share ownership base. Following this transaction, PT Saranakelola Investa's ownership in KARW decreased from 80.28% to 79.14%.

tickerNews.title: GZCO injects capital into subsidiary to strengthen its capital structure
tickerNews.content: Gozco Plantations ($GZCO) through its subsidiary, PT Suryabumi Agrolanggeng, injected capital amounting to 370 billion rupiah into its business entity, PT Sinar Karya Mandiri. After this transaction, PT Suryabumi Agrolanggeng's ownership in PT Sinar Karya Mandiri increased from 99.8% to 99.9%. PT Sinar Karya Mandiri is a palm oil plantation company located in Ketapang, West Kalimantan. This transaction is intended to strengthen the capital structure of PT Sinar Karya Mandiri.

tickerNews.title: FASW plans rights issue to reduce liabilities and boost working capital
tickerNews.content: Fajar Surya Wisesa ($FASW) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 1 billion new shares with an dilution effect of up to 28.75%. The ratio and exercise price have not yet been announced, while the proceeds are intended to reduce liabilities and increase the company's working capital. This plan will be discussed in the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on January 22, 2025.
